Memories! Favorite Monster Rancher Quotes:
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2002 Topics ( Year Of The Password): Memories! Favorite Monster Rancher Quotes:
By BlackArrow on Monday, December 2, 2002 - 12:13 am:

Well, December is here, which means a New Year is breathing down our tired, sweaty necks. What better time to remember our family, loved ones, our past sucesses, the fun we had, and:
Monster Rancher Quotes!

"We can ride on its back because it has no wings on its back" -Fairy Saurian card text

"It will move seductively when someone touches its horn" -Skipper card text

"You are guarinteed a good night's sleep if you sleep on it" -Blue Sponge card text (It doesn't seem like the best idea to sleep on a Monol, does it?)

And no matter how sad things may get this holiday season, just remember:
"Dropping tears does not always mean the sadness"
- MustardArrow card text

By BlackArrow on Friday, December 6, 2002 - 11:02 pm:

Here are a few more...
(at he Ima vs Fimba) "let's get into a hot, hot fight!"

Colt- "The Centaur? I might have read about it in an old school textbook." (Colt kickin it ol skool!)

"It's red eye is due to the fact that it stays up late." - Red Eye card text

By torey luvullo on Thursday, December 12, 2002 - 10:05 pm:

i finally found my favorite mr3 quote - the description of hohocto, an octopee subbreed:

This Octopee lives in trees. However, they are very bad at climbing, so once they fall out of a tree, they can't get back up again.

it sounds to me like hohoctoes live in trees, until they suddenly don't anymore! and it isn't like baby hohoctoes somehow get back into the trees to begin the process again. bottom line: hohoctoes live in trees, except they really don't.

By Petit-Trot on Friday, December 13, 2002 - 10:01 am:

Maybe only a few fall, and they are doomed to live there. The others live all their lives (and reproduce) in the trees.

By GoldenBoy on Friday, December 13, 2002 - 04:45 pm:

maybe as soon as they fall out of a tree they
aren't a hohoctoe any more? But then, how can you
raise one at a ranch? My head hurts....

By torey luvullo on Friday, December 13, 2002 - 07:42 pm:

pt's explanation makes sense, but that seems to create two tribes of hohoctoes. disrupts my vision of hohoctoes living in unity and harmony...

By BlackArrow on Friday, December 13, 2002 - 08:14 pm:

If they're bad at climbing, why live in the trees? Maybe that's how breeders get them. They walk around and poke at them with sticks. Knock them out of the tree, then take them home. But if they're bad climbers, what do they eat? Do they just sit up there with their mouths open, waiting for birds? My head is starting to hurt, too...

Oh, Found another great quote: Colt- (after finding Joker Mask) "I wonder if they used to put it on and dance like this..." Dr.Talrico- "NO!"
Then later, when Pabs sees it: Pabs- "Wow, that's one creepy mask. I wonder if they used to wear it like this? Oh no! I can't take it off!" Dr. Talrico- "I can't believe he tried it on without at least studying it first."

Does the Joker mask make people into idiots? Exactly HOW did Colt think they danced? What does a clown mask have to do with dancing anyway? From Colt, that's suprising. (But I think I'd like to see the dance). From Pabs, I expected as much. I think if you told Pabs your Gaboo had a stomach problem, he'd put his head into it's mouth and look.

And if he's such a good rancher, how come he's not busy raising his own *&$#%@$ monsters, instead of strolling over to my ranch whenever he feels like it, taking a dip in my hot springs, and putting crazy masks on his head?

By torey luvullo on Friday, December 13, 2002 - 08:45 pm:

my take on pabs - he's a blowhard wannabe who got lucky with one monster [most] and spends the rest of his life lording it over everyone.

By BlackArrow on Friday, December 13, 2002 - 08:57 pm:

Ah... I haven't got to Most. Didn't realize he's the trainer. Makes me dislike him even more. I wish you'd get to see Pabs house when Colt says "let's go to Pabs house" when construction is being done on yours. I bet it's full of empty cup jells, paradoxine, twinkies, nudie mags, dirty clothes and cheap beer. And the binoculars he uses to watch Colt, of course.

It would be funnier if Pabs was a letcherous old man, making passes at Colt. At least then I would understand why he's always at the ranch.

By GoldenBoy on Saturday, December 14, 2002 - 02:50 pm:

Actually, a running gag that brought Thorr and I
endless laughs was thinking of Karn(ab) as a
dirty old man in MR1.

He had a real unhealthy relationship with Holly
where he took her and your monster off into the
wilderness for a month at a time.

That, in my mind, is the real reason Holly
doesn't want to explore at the beginning of MRA2.

By BlackArrow on Wednesday, December 18, 2002 - 10:25 pm:

Part of Colt's moving speech upon obtaining Master rank: "An amount of time that feels long ago and also short, has passed since we first met here." What poetry...

I just unlocked the Metaliner. I couldn't believe the thing left a crop circle! But did anyone notice how rude Pabs is to Colt the whole time? He tells her to shut up, and says other mean stuff to her. Then again, she says this, which is so far my favorite quote:
"Wow! We're gonna have a close encounter of the 3rd kind tonight, right?"

By BlackArrow on Saturday, December 21, 2002 - 09:11 pm:

He could be killed by the Wracky.
Colt: "Charles, NOOOOOOooooOOOoo! What have you done! Pabs! Who's going to clean this up?"

Then the monster you got would be Pab's decapitated head. It would attack with int based sleep and bore attacks, baking the monsters tired. Would have a close range babble attack, E/S/S/E, and pow moves like "Shut up" and "overbite". And when it dies, instead of a funeral, everyone throws a party on the ranch.
